header.title: Criminal Court of Appeal
header.subtitle: A Comprehensive Guide to the Role and Functions of the Criminal Court of Appeal.
definition.title: Criminal Court of Appeal
definition.item1: Within every governorate, there is one or more courts of appeal.
definition.item2: The Court of Appeal consists of 3 judges: a president and two consultants.
definition.item3: The public prosecution is represented before the Court of Appeal by the Appellate Public Prosecutor or an Attorney General
jurisdiction.title: Jurisdiction
jurisdiction.text1: The Court of Appeal considers the appeal of all judgments issued by the Criminal Single Judge
jurisdiction.text2: in the cases of misdemeanors, provided that they shall have been settled in the merits of the dispute.
jurisdiction.exception1: The appeal of decisions that settle one or more of the formal defenses stipulated in Article 73 of the Criminal Procedures Code shall be accepted.
jurisdiction.exception2: Decisions by which the Single Judge terminates the lawsuit without addressing its subject matter.
jurisdiction.exception3: Decisions issued on accepting or revoking the release requests
violation.title: Violations
violation.text1: The Court of Appeal considers the appeal of the judgments issued by the Criminal Single Judge in the cases of violations, provided that they shall be on:
violation.item1: Imprisonment, preventive detention or a fine of more than five hundred thousand Lebanese pounds.
violation.item2: Additional or secondary penalty or personal compensations of more than five hundred thousand Lebanese pounds.
violation.item3: Revocation of defense stipulated in Article 73 of the Criminal Procedures Code.
violation.item4: Penalty for a violation correlative with a misdemeanor.
judgment.title: Judgments
judgment.note: The Court of Appeal is entitled, when exercising its tasks, to listen to witnesses, interrogate the parties of the lawsuit, invite new witnesses, appoint an expert, listen to experts, and carry out any new investigations it deems appropriate...
judgment.delayPlaintiffDefendant: Regarding plaintiffs, defendants, persons responsible for money, and guarantors, the appeal must be submitted within 15 days:
judgment.delayPlaintiffDefendantDetails: From the date of its issuance if it is made in person, or from the date of notification if it is made in absentia.
judgment.delayAppellateProsecutor: For the Appellate Public Prosecutor, the appeal must be submitted within one month:
judgment.delayAppellateProsecutorDetails: From the date of issuance of the judgment.
judgment.delayAppellateProsecution: For the Appellate Public Prosecution, the appeal must be submitted within two months:
judgment.delayAppellateProsecutionDetail: From the date of issuance of the judgment.
judgment.decisionDefenses: Decision on Accepting or Rejecting Defenses Stated in Article 73 of the Criminal Procedures Code:
judgment.appealLawyer: Appeals must be submitted through a lawyer.
judgment.delayPublicProsecution: For the Public Prosecution, the appeal must be submitted within 24 hours:
judgment.delayPublicProsecutionDetails: From the date of the decision's issuance.
judgment.delayOpponents: For the opposing parties, the appeal must be submitted within 24 hours:
judgment.delayOpponentsDetails: From the date of notifying the opposing parties.
judgment.decisionCourtAppeal: Decision of the Court of Appeal
